speaker: PUCK
text_entry: SCENE II. Another part of the wood.

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Enter TITANIA, with her train

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Come, now a roundel and a fairy song;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Then, for the third part of a minute, hence;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Some to kill cankers in the musk-rose buds,

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Some war with rere-mice for their leathern wings,

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: To make my small elves coats, and some keep back

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: The clamorous owl that nightly hoots and wonders

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: At our quaint spirits. Sing me now asleep;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Then to your offices and let me rest.

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: The Fairies sing

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: You spotted snakes with double tongue,

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Thorny hedgehogs, be not seen;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Newts and blind-worms, do no wrong,

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Come not near our fairy queen.

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Philomel, with melody

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Sing in our sweet lullaby;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Lulla, lulla, lullaby, lulla, lulla, lullaby:

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Never harm,

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Nor spell nor charm,

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Come our lovely lady nigh;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: So, good night, with lullaby.

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Weaving spiders, come not here;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Hence, you long-legg'd spinners, hence!

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Beetles black, approach not near;

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Worm nor snail, do no offence.

speaker: TITANIA
text_entry: Philomel, with melody,  and c.

speaker: Fairy
text_entry: Hence, away! now all is well:

speaker: Fairy
text_entry: One aloof stand sentinel.

speaker: Fairy
text_entry: Exeunt Fairies. TITANIA sleeps

speaker: Fairy
text_entry: Enter OBERON and squeezes the flower on TITANIA's eyelids

speaker: OBERON
text_entry: What thou seest when thou dost wake,

speaker: OBERON
text_entry: Do it for thy true-love take,

speaker: OBERON
text_entry: Love and languish for his sake:

speaker: OBERON
text_entry: Be it ounce, or cat, or bear,

speaker: OBERON
text_entry: Pard, or boar with bristled hair,

speaker: OBERON
text_entry: In thy eye that shall appear

speaker: OBERON
text_entry: When thou wakest, it is thy dear:

speaker: OBERON
text_entry: Wake when some vile thing is near.

speaker: OBERON
text_entry: Exit

speaker: OBERON
text_entry: Enter LYSANDER and HERMIA

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Fair love, you faint with wandering in the wood;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And to speak troth, I have forgot our way:

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: We'll rest us, Hermia, if you think it good,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And tarry for the comfort of the day.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Be it so, Lysander: find you out a bed;

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: For I upon this bank will rest my head.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: One turf shall serve as pillow for us both;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: One heart, one bed, two bosoms and one troth.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Nay, good Lysander; for my sake, my dear,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Lie further off yet, do not lie so near.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: O, take the sense, sweet, of my innocence!

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Love takes the meaning in love's conference.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: I mean, that my heart unto yours is knit

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: So that but one heart we can make of it;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Two bosoms interchained with an oath;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: So then two bosoms and a single troth.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Then by your side no bed-room me deny;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: For lying so, Hermia, I do not lie.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Lysander riddles very prettily:

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Now much beshrew my manners and my pride,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: If Hermia meant to say Lysander lied.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: But, gentle friend, for love and courtesy

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Lie further off; in human modesty,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Such separation as may well be said

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Becomes a virtuous bachelor and a maid,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: So far be distant; and, good night, sweet friend:

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Thy love ne'er alter till thy sweet life end!

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Amen, amen, to that fair prayer, say I;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And then end life when I end loyalty!

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Here is my bed: sleep give thee all his rest!

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: With half that wish the wisher's eyes be press'd!

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: They sleep

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Enter PUCK

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Through the forest have I gone.

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: But Athenian found I none,

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: On whose eyes I might approve

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: This flower's force in stirring love.

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Night and silence.--Who is here?

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Weeds of Athens he doth wear:

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: This is he, my master said,

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Despised the Athenian maid;

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: And here the maiden, sleeping sound,

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: On the dank and dirty ground.

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Pretty soul! she durst not lie

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Near this lack-love, this kill-courtesy.

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Churl, upon thy eyes I throw

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: All the power this charm doth owe.

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: When thou wakest, let love forbid

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Sleep his seat on thy eyelid:

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: So awake when I am gone;

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: For I must now to Oberon.

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PUCK
text_entry: Enter DEMETRIUS and HELENA, running

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Stay, though thou kill me, sweet Demetrius.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: I charge thee, hence, and do not haunt me thus.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: O, wilt thou darkling leave me? do not so.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Stay, on thy peril: I alone will go.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: O, I am out of breath in this fond chase!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The more my prayer, the lesser is my grace.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Happy is Hermia, wheresoe'er she lies;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: For she hath blessed and attractive eyes.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: How came her eyes so bright? Not with salt tears:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: If so, my eyes are oftener wash'd than hers.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: No, no, I am as ugly as a bear;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: For beasts that meet me run away for fear:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Therefore no marvel though Demetrius

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Do, as a monster fly my presence thus.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: What wicked and dissembling glass of mine

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Made me compare with Hermia's sphery eyne?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But who is here? Lysander! on the ground!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Dead? or asleep? I see no blood, no wound.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Lysander if you live, good sir, awake.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: [Awaking]  And run through fire I will for thy sweet sake.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Transparent Helena! Nature shows art,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: That through thy bosom makes me see thy heart.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Where is Demetrius? O, how fit a word

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Is that vile name to perish on my sword!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Do not say so, Lysander; say not so

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: What though he love your Hermia? Lord, what though?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Yet Hermia still loves you: then be content.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Content with Hermia! No; I do repent

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: The tedious minutes I with her have spent.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Not Hermia but Helena I love:

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Who will not change a raven for a dove?

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: The will of man is by his reason sway'd;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And reason says you are the worthier maid.

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Things growing are not ripe until their season

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: So I, being young, till now ripe not to reason;

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And touching now the point of human skill,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Reason becomes the marshal to my will

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And leads me to your eyes, where I o'erlook

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Love's stories written in love's richest book.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Wherefore was I to this keen mockery born?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: When at your hands did I deserve this scorn?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Is't not enough, is't not enough, young man,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That I did never, no, nor never can,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Deserve a sweet look from Demetrius' eye,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But you must flout my insufficiency?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Good troth, you do me wrong, good sooth, you do,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: In such disdainful manner me to woo.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But fare you well: perforce I must confess

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I thought you lord of more true gentleness.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: O, that a lady, of one man refused.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Should of another therefore be abused!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: She sees not Hermia. Hermia, sleep thou there:

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And never mayst thou come Lysander near!

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: For as a surfeit of the sweetest things

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: The deepest loathing to the stomach brings,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Or as tie heresies that men do leave

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Are hated most of those they did deceive,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: So thou, my surfeit and my heresy,

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Of all be hated, but the most of me!

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: And, all my powers, address your love and might

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: To honour Helen and to be her knight!

speaker: LYSANDER
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: [Awaking]  Help me, Lysander, help me! do thy best

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: To pluck this crawling serpent from my breast!

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Ay me, for pity! what a dream was here!

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Lysander, look how I do quake with fear:

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Methought a serpent eat my heart away,

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: And you sat smiling at his cruel pray.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Lysander! what, removed? Lysander! lord!

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: What, out of hearing? gone? no sound, no word?

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Alack, where are you speak, an if you hear;

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Speak, of all loves! I swoon almost with fear.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: No? then I well perceive you all not nigh

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Either death or you I'll find immediately.

speaker: HERMIA
text_entry: Exit
